required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effectiveness and Safety of Ali-Robotics
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multicenter, Self Controlled Evaluation of the Effectiveness and Safety of Lower Limb Exoskeleton Rehabilitation Training Robot

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the effectiveness and safety of the lower extremity exoskeleton rehabilitation training robot

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation of the effectiveness and safety of the lower extremity exoskeleton rehabilitation training robot developed by AI-Robotics Technology Co., Ltd., Beijing for who had lower limb paralysis

primary_outcome.description: average heart increasing rate,measured by times/min

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during 6 minute walk test and right before the 6MWT
secondary_outcome.description: heart rate during and after 6 minute walk test

secondary_outcome.measure: efficiency of put on or take off the Ailegs/Aiwalker/HKAFO
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately before beginning (pre-) and immediately after finishing (post-) each of 6 minute walk test
secondary_outcome.description: to measure the time of putting on or taking off the Ailegs/Aiwalker/HKAFO before or after 6 min walk test
the RPE is recorded after the 6 min walk test

clinical_study.condition: Lower Extremity Motor Dysfunction, Spinal Cord Injury

arm_group.description: use of lower extremity rehabilitation training robot assisted walking (including AiLegs, AiWalker)
use hip and knee ankle foot orthosis (HKAFO) assisted walking

intervention.description: 5 days. Using their own control method, each morning using AiLegs, AiWalker AiWalker and HKAFO for 6 minutes walk test, three kinds of appliance between at least 30 minutes to determine heart rate, blood pressure and breathing back to quiet level. Repeat the same procedure in the afternoon ，the order is also random. Each participant will complete 10 groups of lower limb exoskeleton rehabilitation Training robot (including AiLegs, AiWalker two models) and HKAFO 6 minutes walking test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. more than18 but less than 60 years old，less than 80 kilos of weight，Gender is not limited
2. Confirmed by MR/CT，AIS spinal cord injury grade: A-C level (without walking ability)：Damage plane T6-L2
3. The muscle tension of the modified Ashworth grade level is less than or equal to 2
4. The range of passive motion of the hip and knee joint of the patient is approximately normal in the ankle joint Neutral position
5. Upper limb strength and physical strength are sufficient to stabilize the crutches
6. Patients are able to understand and actively participate in the training program, agree and sign the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
1. The range of motion of the joints is severely limited and the walking action is limited
2. Spinal fractures are not completely healed, the clinical situation is unstable; if not fully confirmed,please go department of orthopedics or other clinical departments for diagnosing
3. Skin injury or infection of the lower extremities or the part of wearing robot
4. Unstable angina, severe arrhythmia and other heart diseases
5. Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
6. Unilateral neglect
7. Severe cognitive or visual impairment
8. Other contraindications or complications that may affect walking training
9. Pregnant or lactating women
10. The investigators find that patients with poor compliance, unable to complete the study in accordance with the requirements

facility.name: The 1St Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing University
